cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving slowly west-northwest into southeastern North Carolina, then expected to drift west-southwest, turn north across the western Carolinas and central Appalachians, and finally curve northeast toward the Mid-Atlantic/Northeast early next week. It is not forecast to track toward the Great Lakes.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for Great Lakes; hurricane and storm-surge watches confined to SC–NC coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical-Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and Mid-Atlantic U.S. coastline, primarily North and South Carolina
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Detroit not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions (generally below gale force) possible early next week as remnant low passes well southeast of the Great Lakes.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands (<2 inches) possible 16–18 Sep.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river-stage rises possible from upstream runoff, but no direct coastal impacts for this inland port.
